title: Why do some people believe gravity does not exist? - Quora

response.answer_text: “Why do some people believe gravity does not exist?” Do you mean gravity, as in a “force”, that magically attracts one object to another, across a void, and is not divisible, or explainable with an underlying mechanism? Gravity, as an innate property of matter? Gravity as it is commonly accepted that it was “envisioned and asserted to exist per Newton”?  I mean, we are not discussing whether some accept that the repeatedly observable phenomenon exists, are we? You toss a cannon ball in the air, the cannon ball falls to the ground. We are not discussing those who would suggest “no it does not”, are we? Cause that would be silly. Why would we bother. We know what we see. And in that sense, gravity definitely exists. If that is what we are discussing. People who think cannon balls do not fall to the Earth, then stop reading here. Look elsewhere for you answer.  If we are discussing the “force” as an innate property of matter. Action at a distance across a void. Magic. Then read on. For I am “that guy”. One “of those”. And I have my reasons. Well thought out reasons. Reasons I have worked for years to come up with. Don’t expect a short answer. It’s not. Don’t expect a simple answer. It’s not. But if you really want to know. I will give it my very best shot to explain. If I don’t finish, remind me and I will come back and continue. It’s late where I am, and I may run out of steam.  GRAVITY Perhaps you know. Quantum mechanics does NOT include gravity. Perhaps you know, there are two dozen or so “candidate theories of quantum gravity” attempting to explain and mathematically describe whatever underlying field or agent or combination of somethings, that cause that darn cannon ball, to appear to fall. It falls. I do not argue that. Newton also did not argue that the ball falls. He observed the phenomena closely. He measured and calculated and gave us what we call the “Newton’s Law of Gravity”. So let’s start there. We’ll come back to quantum mechanics and quantum gravity. We all know the common stuff about Newton. The whole apple story (whether true or false), and his calculations. But did you know that in a letter to some guy named Bentley, he had these specific comments to make: (From this web site: Original letter from Isaac Newton to Richard Bentley) Newton said this: “Tis unconceivable that inanimate brute matter should (without the mediation of something else which is not material) operate upon & affect other matter without mutual contact; as it must if gravitation in the sense of Epicurus be essential & inherent in it.” And Newton said this: “And this is one reason why I desired you would not ascribe {innate} gravity to me.” And Newton said this: “That gravity should be innate inherent & {essential} to matter so that one body may act upon another at a distance through a vacuum without the mediation of any thing else by & through which their action or force {may} be conveyed from one to another is to me so great an absurdity that I believe no man who has in philosophical matters any competent faculty of thinking can ever fall into it.” Interesting, eh? Newton HIMSELF, not only did not believe in the “force” of gravity. But thought it an “absurdity”. And thought any who believed in the “force” of gravity was an incompetent thinker devoid of his faculties. Couldn’t be much clearer than that, could he? He finished that paragraph with this closing sentence: Gravity must be caused by an agent {acting} constantly according to certain laws, but whether this agent be material or immaterial is a question I have left to the consideration of my readers. In short, he reported what he observed. He had his own thoughts as to the cause, but rather than assert that which he did not know, or not know, he left the decision as to the nature of gravity to the discretion of his readers. He did not in his texts even so go far as to attempt to sway them by calling them incompetent or absurd if they thought gravity to be a force. He left them free to make their conclusions without even that influence. A wise man was Newton.  Fast forward to Einstein. He gave us better calculations. But not perfect. If they were perfect, then spiral arms would move as his calculations predicted and there would be no need to invoke the presence of Dark Matter and Dark Energy, in order to stop his equations from being falsified and tossed in the garbage. BUT. Einstein tried and failed, for 40 years to come up with equations that would unify quantum mechanics and relativity. AND. He died before we knew there were problems requiring the inference of Dark Matter and Dark Energy. He once said, “A hundred experiments may prove me right, it takes only one experiment to prove me wrong.” (I paraphrase from memory, forgive if that is a little off, I am sure I got the sentiment correct). I also heard that when presented with the theory of a Big Bang, he said something like “Sir, your calculations and knowledge of mathematics seem spot on” (they were after all based on his own equations), “however your knowledge and understanding of physics sucks”. (paraphrased again, lol). IF Einstein were here today, would Einstein, do you think, continue to assert that relativity was the truth, the whole truth, and nothing but the truth? I suggest not.  Enough prefacing. I am going to provide a concept. One I think is correct. But i am going to only give the short version. (I am as I thought I would, running out of steam). Ask for more, if I don’t get back to it, and I will get back to it.  GRAVITY, AS AN EMERGENT PHENOMENA. (My personal explanation, not to be confused with the theory of Erik Verlinde, which is not the same). First I suggest, matter is not physically substantial. Rather it is made of paired progression and regression of waves, in sets, orbiting a common center, while propagating through a “vibrating” mechanical field. So what is “physical”. The particles that make up the “vibrating” mechanical field. Or put another way. To build a universe, from scratch. Start with an infinite void. Fill the infinite void with an infinite number of Planck scale, permanent, particles, that are all identical, and are all exactly this shape:  Pack them all in close to one another. Till they are adapt the mathematics of “close-packed spheres”: Close-packing of equal spheres - Wikipedia But remember, these are not “perfect regular spheres”. They are wave-deformed spheroids. So although on average they can adapt to the mathematics of close packed spheres, if you rotate one, it’s 12 neighbours will experience pushes, and relief from being pushed. As you can see from the nature of the shape of the individual particles. Every particle will be surrounded by 12 neighbours.  (Image is from this web site: The cuboctahedron) Now imagine, in a universe filled entirely with close-packed-wave-deformed-spheroids, if every one of them was to spin at a high rate of speed, all in the same direction. Clockwise.  (you have to mentally add layers on top as well, to imagine a universe filled with the Red-Blue-Blur-Ball shapes.) That is what I believe, and expect we will determine, the universe is made of. An infinite number of these, in a propertyless void, with no charges, nor forces, and no friction acting upon them, all rotating at high speed, creating a “field”. Similar to, but not identical to David Bohm’s Pilot Wave Field. To take a step back and show it more visually, this is the concept in a nutshell:   And thus, I do not, as Newton himself did not, believe in the “force” of gravity. I do not believe in “gravity as an innate property of matter”. I believe in the transfer of frequency, wavelength, orientation, and polarity, and the progression and balanced regression of these features of the field when in harmonious, or less than harmonious motion.  A couple more quick points, before I quit for the night. The “negative space”. That is, the space between the balls. IF they were perfect regular spheres, the negative spaces would be, tetrahedrons and octahedrons.  (I got the picture from another answer given here on Quora, I do not know the original source. It shows what I want to show. I do not suggest any relation to the contents of the other answer:What are the positions of tetrahedral and octahedral voids in an HCP unit cell?) So, the collection of shapes, assembled and spinning and oscillating due to the shape of the wave-deformed spheroid are Cuboctahedrons, Tetrahedrons, and Octahedrons, and the shape itself. I should add in, that the shape of the wave-deformed spheroid itself, is the mathematical combination of an e-mode wave-function and a b-mode wave function.  Put one e-mode and one b-mode together, and you get:   Now, I am not suggesting (yet), that you should stop believing in “Gravity as a Force”. I haven’t nearly presented all the necessary evidence to suggest such. But I am going to wrap up for now, and come back to this. In the meantime, I’ll ask this question. Have you ever asked yourself, “why do you believe in forces, that is, action at a distance across a void”.  Some circumstantial pattern comparisons that may, or may not be supportive. Like Newton said, “Forces” as in, action at a distance, and “pure un-contained energy” (energy with no medium”, if they don’t “need” to exist, to explain existence… IF a physical, mechanical “clock-work-like” mechanism, can show that it’s properties, show up in a “fractal” or “inverse holographic” demonstration (are observable/infer-able at various scales, throughout physics, If like a convoluted set of gears, in a massive machine, CAN, viably, explain the perception of “forces”, and the perception of “particle wave duality”, and orientablity, and polarity, and relativity, and visibility, and heat and friction, ans all the rest, Then, thereafter to imagine that “action at a distance”, or anything else that seems “counter-intuitive”, or “without logical justification”, Just would no longer feel “right”.  Clockwork universe - Wikipedia   But, we HAD to generate a belief in “dark energy, and dark matter”, so what would Einstein say about that?  So, we have to consider the necessary inferred existence of “dark matter” and “dark energy”. A “crack” in relativity. Einstein said: "From the just proved assertion, that the speed of light in a gravity field is a function of position, it is easily deduced from Huygens's principle that light rays propagating at right angles to the gravity field must experience curvature." And: “The principle of the constancy of the speed of light can be kept only when one restricts oneself to space-time regions of constant gravitational potential.” From this Wikipedia page: Variable speed of light - Wikipedia Einstein believed in a 4D universe. E=mc^2 IF ALL mass is treated as “pointlike”, and has “spin”, and “polarity” and “orientation”, and THEIR INVERSE, then, All things are going in every direction and back again, in order to be considered “a point”. Dark matter and dark energy “permeate” existence. Inferred. They are “medium-like”. The “radius” of wavelength x frequency is inverse to frequency x wavelength. At all “points” as all times. For each expanding point, all 4 dimensions exist. And all “points” are part of, integrated with, the “gravitational field” and the “3D” existential field.   CUBOCTAHEDRON Are there patterns which lend credence to a cuboctahedron based universe, indicating close packed spheres. Consider the Amplituhedron:   (Ignore the little math pieces under the drawing on the bottom left. A little about the amplituhedron (or what I call the “hyper-coboctahedron”, 6 descending and 6 ascending waves, occupying the same time and space, matched and inseparable from one another. Going forward and backward at the same time. An amplituhedron is a geometric structure introduced in 2013 by Nima Arkani-Hamed and Jaroslav Trnka. It enables simplified calculation of particle interactions in some quantum field theories. In planar N = 4 supersymmetric Yang–Mills theory, also equivalent to the perturbative topological B model string theory in twistor space, an amplituhedron is defined as a mathematical space known as the positive Grassmannian. Amplituhedron theory challenges the notion that space-time locality and unitarity are necessary components of a model of particle interactions. Instead, they are treated as properties that emerge from an underlying phenomenon. The connection between the amplituhedron and scattering amplitudes is at present a conjecture that has passed many non-trivial checks, including an understanding of how locality and unitarity arise as consequences of positivity. Research has been led by Nima Arkani-Hamed. Edward Witten described the work as “very unexpected" and said that "it is difficult to guess what will happen or what the lessons will turn out to be." The only group I know of that believes that seems to be the Flat Earthers. Their problem is a bit complicated - and there are several competing flat earth theories (all of which are untenable) that require different consideration. Some Flat Earthers claim that the Earth is a circular disk - like a coin, say. With tall walls of ice around the rim to prevent the oceans (and maybe the air) from falling over the edge. If this were the case then the center of gravity of the disk would be in the middle - somewhere deep below the North Pole. If this were true - and there was gravity as we know it - then as you moved away from the pole - gravity would no longer pull straight down - but rather at an increasingly diagonal angle! So you’d feel like you were walking uphill - even on level ground! Even the Flat Earthers can’t cope with that idea…so they can’t accept gravity as a fact.Other Flat Earthers claim that the Earth is more like a cylinder - maybe long and thin like a pencil - with us living on the flat end of the cylinder. If the cylinder was VERY long compared to the diameter - then conventional gravity would be VERY nearly vertical everywhere. So these Flat Earthers COULD be content to believe in gravity. However, if they do that then there are problems with what holds up the Sun and Moon and prevents them from falling to Earth. Note that for other complicated reasons, they have to believe that both Sun and Moon are only about 3,000 to 4,000 miles above the surface of the Earth and each are about 30 miles across(!!) - so with regular gravity, they’d just fall down!Yet others claim that the Earth is an infinitely large flat plane. Almost all of it is covered in a thick ice sheet - but the part we live in is a circular hole in the ice. The thickness of the Earth is immaterial. These people are under the mistaken impression that gravity would cause problems for this idea too - but in fact, it would not - because the gravitational pull of an infinite plane of any thickness you like is always straight down. But because they don’t seem to have thought of this - they too are mostly disbelievers in gravity.So - if not “gravity” then what? The general idea (which is actually kinda clever) is that some unknown force (cosmic acceleration or universal acceleration or electromagnetic acceleration) is pushing the (flat) Earth, Moon, Sun, stars and (tiny) planets upwards with a constant acceleration of 9.8 meters per second squared. If that were true (and there were no gravity) - then it would indeed FEEL like that was gravity present. Many non-Flat Earthers complain that the speed of the Earth would very soon exceed the speed of light - which is impossible. But that’s a mis-reading of the theory of relativity - and for once, I have to leap to the aid of the flat earthers and point out that speed must always be measured RELATIVE to something - and there is nothing to measure it’s speed relative TO if everything is moving at the same speed. What fails with this theory is the details: We know that (because the real world Earth isn’t a perfect sphere - and because it’s spinning) - there is less gravity at the equator than at the poles. The universally accelerating Flat Earth would have precisely the same acceleration (and therefore the same feeling of fake-gravity) everywhere.We know that there is less gravity at the tops of tall mountains - which universal acceleration can’t explain.When you are out at sea - where there is relatively low density water beneath you and less high density rock - or where the composition of the rocks beneath you is different - you get slightly different gravity readings…so, same problem again.What about tides? When the sun or moon is overhead - the apparent downward acceleration is lessened - which can’t be explained by upward acceleration alone. Sometimes they try to “fix” this by claiming that the sun and moon “attract” water upwards (which seems a lot like “gravity” to me!)…but what they fail to understand is that you get a high tide both when the Moon is overhead AND 13 hours later when it’s below your feet. The “moon attracts water” idea fails to explain that second tide - which in reality is due to the fact that the Earth/Moon system rotates about a point that’s not at the center of the Earth - so we have a small amount of centrifugal force being exerted on the side of the Earth furthest from the Moon - which causes that second tide.Personally, I also dislike the theory because the Earth (which appears to be made of rocks) is being universally accelerated - but if I dig up a rock and drop it - then it falls to the ground…meaning that it’s no longer being accelerated by the mysterious force. The whole theory is a typical Flat Earther mess. When faced with one problem with their theory (why doesn’t the gravity vector tilt?) they come up with a quick reaction to it (the Earth is accelerating upwards) - and DON’T think through all of the ramifications of that idea before getting so invested in it that they will not re-think it. What’s bizarre is that if they quietly dropped the “coin-shaped” Earth and instead went with a very long cylinder or an infinite plane - then gravity would have worked out just fine for them. But these people aren’t the sharpest tools in the shed…so we can’t expect logic or reason to penetrate their skulls.
